revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Venus over the Sun in 1761
tldr: The author, Nathanael Bliss, describes his observations of the transit of Venus over the Sun in 1761. He discusses the importance of such observations for determining the Sun's parallax and improving astronomical knowledge. The observations were made using a micrometer, and the results are analyzed to determine the right ascension and declination of Venus. This work contributed to the understanding of celestial mechanics and the development of astronomical instruments.
